title: 'I didn't say anything, I just left': Sydney tradie walks off job after winning Lotto's $50MILLION
text:
A Sydney tradesman has walked off the job after finding out he'd won Lotto's $50million jackpot.

The anonymous winner from Leumeah in Sydney's south-west was the only Division One winner in Tuesday's draw, claiming the entire cash prize to himself.

After hearing about a winning ticket being purchased in his area, the man checked his numbers online at work and was shocked at what he found.

'I still wasn't sure I'd won, so I called my daughter and asked her to check the numbers and she said to me 'oh my god dad, I think you've won!' the winning player said.

A Sydney tradesman has walked off the job after finding out he won Lotto's $50million jackpot

'As soon as she said that I just walked out from work. I didn't say anything. I was just thinking 'oh my god.'

The victor has no intentions of going back to work, planning to buy a house near the beach and spend his days playing golf and fishing with his family and friends.

'But money is not everything to me. My friends and family mean more to me than money, so I want to use it wisely and I want to share it with them.'

The tradesman was the 10th Division One winner in 2019.
description: The anonymous winner from Leumeah in Sydney's south-west was the only Division One winner in Tuesday's draw, claiming the entire cash prize to himself.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
